comments: Professor Shaman was characterized as being articulate, accessible, approachable, but with a rather dry lecture style except for a few golden humorous moments. There were some complaints of the relevance of the casebook to material on exams, as well as some concerns about the length and focus on use of JMP software on homework assignments.  A few students also felt that the course material was not tied into larger business concepts. Many reviewers had more problems with the subject of Statistics than the course itself.
